meanings.definition: A type of firearm with a flintlock mechanism for igniting the gunpowder.
meanings.sent1: The soldier aimed the firelock carefully at the target.
meanings.sent2: Hunters in the past used the firelock to hunt for food.
meanings.sent3: The firelock seemed to have a mind of its own, always ready to shoot.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a firelock, always ready to ignite his actions.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the firelock echoed through the forest, signaling the start of the hunt.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would firelock the muskets for the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: He decided to firelock his weapon before heading into battle.
meanings.sent3: She playfully threatened to firelock her friend with a toy gun.
meanings.sent4: The idea of change seemed to firelock his mind with determination.
meanings.sent5: The coach would firelock the team with motivation before the big game.
